content:
GacInstalled Class

In this Article

Confirms that a code assembly originates in the global assembly cache (GAC) as evidence for policy evaluation. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public sealed class GacInstalled : System.Security.Policy.EvidenceBase, System.Security.Policy.IIdentityPermissionFactory

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Security.Policy.EvidenceBase
  • GacInstalled

Inherited Members

Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

The presence of GacInstalled evidence produces a GacIdentityPermission in the grant set. If there is a Demand for GacIdentityPermission, the GacIdentityPermission that corresponds to the GacInstalled evidence is compared with the demanded permission.

Constructors summary

GacInstalled()

Initializes a new instance of the GacInstalled class.

Methods summary

Clone()

Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
Copy()

Creates an equivalent copy of the current object.
CreateIdentityPermission(Evidence)

Creates a new identity permission that corresponds to the current object.
Equals(Object)

Indicates whether the current object is equivalent to the specified object.
GetHashCode()

Returns a hash code for the current object.
ToString()

Returns a string representation of the current object.

Constructors

  • GacInstalled()

    Initializes a new instance of the GacInstalled class.

    public GacInstalled ();

    Remarks

    The constructor sets no property values because a GacInstalled object has no properties.

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the GacInstalled constructor. This example is part of a larger example provided for the GacInstalled class. 

                GacInstalled myGacInstalled = new GacInstalled();

            Dim myGacInstalled As New GacInstalled

        GacInstalled ^ myGacInstalled = gcnew GacInstalled;

Methods

  • Clone()

    Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.

    public override System.Security.Policy.EvidenceBase Clone ();

    Returns

    • System.Security.Policy.EvidenceBase

      A new object that is a copy of this instance.

  • Copy()

    Creates an equivalent copy of the current object.

    public object Copy ();

    Returns

    • Object

      An equivalent copy of GacInstalled.

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the Copy method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the GacInstalled class. 

                GacInstalled myGacInstalledCopy = 
                (GacInstalled)myGacInstalled.Copy();
            bool result = myGacInstalled.Equals(myGacInstalledCopy);

            Dim myGacInstalledCopy As GacInstalled = _
            CType(myGacInstalled.Copy(), GacInstalled)
        Dim result As Boolean = myGacInstalled.Equals(myGacInstalledCopy)

        GacInstalled ^ myGacInstalledCopy = 
        dynamic_cast<GacInstalled^>(myGacInstalled->Copy());
    bool result = myGacInstalled->Equals( myGacInstalledCopy );
  • CreateIdentityPermission(Evidence)

    Creates a new identity permission that corresponds to the current object.

    public System.Security.IPermission CreateIdentityPermission (System.Security.Policy.Evidence evidence);

    Parameters

    • evidence
      Evidence

      The Evidence from which to construct the identity permission.

    Returns

    • IPermission

      A new identity permission that corresponds to the current object.

    Remarks

    The GacIdentityPermission can be used to determine whether the calling code is in the global assembly cache.

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the CreateIdentityPermission method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the GacInstalled class. 

                Object [] hostEvidence = {myGacInstalled};
            Object [] assemblyEvidence = {};
            Evidence myEvidence = new Evidence(hostEvidence,assemblyEvidence);
            GacIdentityPermission myPerm = 
                (GacIdentityPermission)myGacInstalled.CreateIdentityPermission(
                myEvidence);
            Console.WriteLine(myPerm.ToXml().ToString());

            Dim hostEvidence() As Object = {myGacInstalled}
        Dim assemblyEvidence() As Object
        Dim myEvidence As New Evidence(hostEvidence, assemblyEvidence)
        Dim myPerm As GacIdentityPermission = _
            CType(myGacInstalled.CreateIdentityPermission(myEvidence), _ 
            GacIdentityPermission)
        Console.WriteLine(myPerm.ToXml().ToString())

        array<Object^>^hostEvidence = {myGacInstalled};
    array<Object^>^assemblyEvidence = {};
    Evidence^ myEvidence = gcnew Evidence( hostEvidence,assemblyEvidence );
    GacIdentityPermission ^ myPerm = dynamic_cast<GacIdentityPermission^>
        (myGacInstalled->CreateIdentityPermission( myEvidence ));
    Console::WriteLine( myPerm->ToXml() );
  • Equals(Object)

    Indicates whether the current object is equivalent to the specified object.

    public override bool Equals (object o);

    Parameters

    • o
      Object

      The object to compare with the current object.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if o is a GacInstalled object; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    GacInstalled objects have no properties to distinguish one from another, so all GacInstalled objects are equal.

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the Equals method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the GacInstalled class. 

                GacMembershipCondition ^ Gac1 = gcnew GacMembershipCondition;
            GacMembershipCondition ^ Gac2 = gcnew GacMembershipCondition;

            // Roundtrip a GacMembershipCondition to and from an XML encoding.
            Gac2->FromXml(Gac1->ToXml());
            bool result = Gac2->Equals(Gac1);
            if (result)
            {
                Console::WriteLine("Result of ToXml() = {0}", Gac2->ToXml());
                Console::WriteLine(
                    "Result of ToFromXml roundtrip = {0}", Gac2);
            }
            else
            {
                Console::WriteLine(Gac2->ToString());
                Console::WriteLine(Gac1->ToString());
                return false;
            }

                Dim Gac1 As New GacMembershipCondition
            Dim Gac2 As New GacMembershipCondition

            ' Roundtrip a GacMembershipCondition to and from an XML encoding.
            Gac2.FromXml(Gac1.ToXml())
            Dim result As Boolean = Gac2.Equals(Gac1)
            If result Then
                Console.WriteLine(("Result of ToXml() = " & _ 
                    Gac2.ToXml().ToString()))
                Console.WriteLine(("Result of ToFromXml roundtrip = " & _ 
                    Gac2.ToString()))
            Else
                Console.WriteLine(Gac2.ToString())
                Console.WriteLine(Gac1.ToString())
                Return False
            End If

                GacMembershipCondition Gac1 = new GacMembershipCondition();
            GacMembershipCondition Gac2 = new GacMembershipCondition();

            // Roundtrip a GacMembershipCondition to and from an XML encoding.
            Gac2.FromXml(Gac1.ToXml());
            bool result = Gac2.Equals(Gac1);
            if (result)
            {
                Console.WriteLine(
                    "Result of ToXml() = " + Gac2.ToXml().ToString());
                Console.WriteLine(
                    "Result of ToFromXml roundtrip = " + Gac2.ToString());
            }
            else
            {
                Console.WriteLine(Gac2.ToString());
                Console.WriteLine(Gac1.ToString());
                return false;
            }
  • GetHashCode()

    Returns a hash code for the current object.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      A hash code for the current object.

    Remarks

    The GetHashCode method returns 0 (zero) because GacInstalled objects have no properties to distinguish one from another.

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the GetHashCode method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the GacInstalled class. 

                Console.WriteLine(
                "Hashcode = " + myGacInstalled.GetHashCode().ToString());

            Console.WriteLine( _
            ("Hashcode = " & myGacInstalled.GetHashCode().ToString()))

        Console::WriteLine( "Hashcode = {0}", myGacInstalled->GetHashCode() );
  • ToString()

    Returns a string representation of the current object.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A string representation of the current object.

    Remarks

    Returns the XML encoding for the current object.

    Example

    The following code example shows the use of the ToString method. This example is part of a larger example provided for the GacInstalled class. 

                Console.WriteLine(myGacInstalled.ToString());

            Console.WriteLine(myGacInstalled.ToString())
    End Sub 'Main 

        Console::WriteLine( myGacInstalled->ToString() );
